comment.text: This translation key is used to display the text "Delete user" in a delete profile ever dialog, likely as the label for a button that initiates the deletion process. It appears on a file line (118) in /packages/client/src/components/dialogs/DeleteProfileEverDialog/index.tsx, suggesting its use in a UI component related to deleting user data.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Sinhala translation "පරිශ්‍රීලකයා මක්නන" is not an accurate translation of "Delete user."  "මක්නන" typically means 'to erase' or 'to remove' but is often used in a more informal or incomplete context.  A more accurate and formal translation would be needed.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: වෙනත් පරිශ්‍රීලකයකු මකන්න (Venath parishiilayakunu makanna) - Delete another user; or පරිශ්‍රීලකයා මකන්න (Parishiilayakunu makanna) - Delete the user.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word "මක්නන" in the Sinhala translation, while potentially used, is not the standard spelling. A more widely accepted spelling may exist depending on the context and dialect.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Check for the precise spelling of the verb relating to deletion within a relevant Sinhala dictionary.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While "Обриши корисника" is understandable, a more accurate and common translation of 'Delete user' in a user interface context would be "Избриши корисника". 'Обриши' generally implies a physical wiping or erasing, while 'Избриши' specifically refers to deleting data.

The English phrase "Delete user" can have multiple accurate Serbian translations depending on the context. "Obriši korisnika" is a literal translation that could be interpreted as "Delete the user" (as opposed to "Delete a user", or "Delete users"). A more neutral and generally applicable translation might be "Izbriši korisnika" or "Briši korisnika".
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider using "Izbriši korisnika" or "Briši korisnika" for a more accurate and context-neutral translation.
